Description: Fisher-Price, of East Aurora, N.Y., agreed to pay a civil penalty of $1.1 million to settle CPSC charges that it failed to report serious safety defects with Power Wheels toy vehicles.

Fisher-Price Inc. agreed to pay a $975,000 civil penalty to settle allegations that the company failed to report to the government that a nail fastener in its Little People Animal Sounds Farm could separate from the toy and pose a serious choking or aspiration hazard to young children.
Mattel Inc. and its wholly owned subsidiary Fisher-Price Inc. agreed to pay a $2.3 million civil penalty for violating the federal lead paint ban.

Description: Mattel agreed to pay $12 million as part of a multistate settlement designed to strengthen the company's efforts to reduce lead levels in its toy products.
Mattel agreed to cease selling toys containing lead and paid $1 million to the state.
